body:
## Problem Frontend container is serving BlockEdge application instead of the audiobook app. ## Evidence Frontend response shows BlockEdge dashboard: ```html IREC Certificates - BlockEdge Platform

IREC Dashboard

``` ## Impact - ‚ùå Wrong application being served on port 3000 - ‚ùå Audiobook frontend not accessible - ‚ùå Cannot test frontend functionality - **User Experience: Completely broken** ## Root Cause Frontend Docker build is copying wrong source code or build context issue. ## Fix Required 1. Check frontend Dockerfile build context 2. Ensure correct audiobook frontend source is copied 3. Verify build process serves audiobook app 4. Test frontend serves correct application ## Priority üî• **HIGH** - Users cannot access audiobook interface
title: üö® HOTFIX: Frontend serving wrong application (BlockEdge instead of Audiobook)

body:
## Problem
Backend, crawler, and parser services are failing to start with MODULE_NOT_FOUND errors for shared logger module.

## Error Details
```
Error: Cannot find module '../../../shared/logger'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1084:15)
```

## Root Cause
Docker builds are not copying the /shared directory into containers, causing import path resolution failures.

## Impact
- ‚ùå Backend service (port 5001): Not operational
- ‚ùå Crawler service (port 3001): Not operational  
- ‚ùå Parser service: Not operational
- **System Status: Critical - Core services down**

## Fix Required
1. Update Dockerfiles to copy shared directory
2. Ensure proper build context includes shared modules
3. Test container builds and imports

## Priority
üî• **CRITICAL** - Blocking entire audiobook pipeline functionality
title: üö® HOTFIX: Shared module access failing in Docker containers
